name: Akira
descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) is a ransomware variant and ransomware deployment entity active since at least March 2023.(Citation: Arctic Wolf Akira 2023) [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses compromised credentials to access single-factor external access mechanisms such as VPNs for initial access, then various publicly-available tools and techniques for lateral movement.(Citation: Arctic Wolf Akira 2023)(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA) [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) operations are associated with "double extortion" ransomware activity, where data is exfiltrated from victim environments prior to encryption, with threats to publish files if a ransom is not paid. Technical analysis of [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1129) ransomware indicates variants capable of targeting Windows or VMWare ESXi hypervisors and multiple overlaps with [Conti](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0575) ransomware.(Citation: BushidoToken Akira 2023)(Citation: CISA Akira Ransomware APR 2024)(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Account Access Removal
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) deletes administrator accounts in victim networks prior to encryption.(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses utilities such as WinRAR to archive data prior to exfiltration.(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) has used PowerShell scripts for credential harvesting and privilege escalation.(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) encrypts files in victim environments as part of ransomware operations.(Citation: BushidoToken Akira 2023)(Citation: CISA Akira Ransomware APR 2024)

subtechniques.name: Sharepoint
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) has accessed and downloaded information stored in SharePoint instances as part of data gathering and exfiltration activity.(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)

technique_table_data.name: Domain Trust Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses the built-in [Nltest](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0359) utility or tools such as [AdFind](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0552) to enumerate Active Directory trusts in victim environments.(Citation: Arctic Wolf Akira 2023)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration to Cloud Storage
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) will exfiltrate victim data using applications such as [Rclone](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1040).(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)

technique_table_data.name: External Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses compromised VPN accounts for initial access to victim networks.(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)

technique_table_data.name: Financial Theft
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) engages in double-extortion ransomware, exfiltrating files then encrypting them, in order to prompt victims to pay a ransom.(Citation: BushidoToken Akira 2023)(Citation: CISA Akira Ransomware APR 2024)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) has disabled or modified security tools for defense evasion.(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) has used legitimate names and locations for files to evade defenses.(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

subtechniques.name: Binary Padding
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) has used binary padding to obfuscate payloads.(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Remote Access Tools
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses legitimate utilities such as AnyDesk and PuTTy for maintaining remote access to victim environments.(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)(Citation: Arctic Wolf Akira 2023)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) has used RDP for lateral movement.(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses software such as Advanced IP Scanner and MASSCAN to identify remote hosts within victim networks.(Citation: Arctic Wolf Akira 2023)

technique_table_data.name: Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) have used scripts to dump Kerberos authentication credentials.(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024) uses valid account information to remotely access victim networks, such as VPN credentials.(Citation: Secureworks GOLD SAHARA)(Citation: Arctic Wolf Akira 2023)(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

software_data.name: Akira
software_data.descr: (Citation: Kersten Akira 2023)(Citation: Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024)

software_data.name: Megazord

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
techniques.sub_name: Exfiltration Over Asymmetric Encrypted Non-C2 Protocol

CISA Akira Ransomware APR 2024.description: CISA et al. (2024, April 18). #StopRansomware: Akira Ransomware. Retrieved December 10, 2024.

Cisco Akira Ransomware OCT 2024.description: Nutland, J. and Szeliga, M. (2024, October 21). Akira ransomware continues to evolve. Retrieved December 10, 2024.

Arctic Wolf Akira 2023.description: Steven Campbell, Akshay Suthar, & Connor Belfiorre. (2023, July 26). Conti and Akira: Chained Together. Retrieved February 20, 2024.

BushidoToken Akira 2023.description: Will Thomas. (2023, September 15). Tracking Adversaries: Akira, another descendent of Conti. Retrieved February 21, 2024.

Palo Alto Howling Scorpius DEC 2024.description: Zemah, Y. (2024, December 2). Threat Assessment: Howling Scorpius (Akira Ransomware). Retrieved January 8, 2025.

Kersten Akira 2023.description: Max Kersten & Alexandre Mundo. (2023, November 29). Akira Ransomware. Retrieved April 4, 2024.
